question.title: Inject Class type in spring component constructor
question.body:
For genericity reason I have some components that have the folowing body:

@Component
public class MyClass<C> extends SomeAbstractClass<A, C> {

    public MyClass(SomeClass1 someClass1, SomeClass2 someClass2) {
        super(superMethod(A.class, C.class));
    }
}

MyClass is just a generic skeleton of my classes, they may or may not have some object in the constructor (represented by SomeClass1 and SomeClass2). The abstract super class takes two classes, here A is explicited, it is not a generic, therefore A.class is valid. But C.class is not valid, since it's a generic class.

So I tried this:

@Component
public class MyClass<C> extends SomeAbstractClass<A, C> {

    public MyClass(SomeClass1 someClass1, SomeClass2 someClass2, Class<C> clazz) {
        super(superMethod(A.class, clazz));
    }
}

This code compiles but Spring cannot inject Class<C> clazz, how can I do it?

Edit: I also tried something that does work but I don't like it so much. I create a class for each generic type as such:

@Component
public class MyClassWithoutGeneric extends SomeAbstractClass<A, B> {

    public MyClassWithoutGeneric(SomeClass1 someClass1, SomeClass2 someClass2) {
        super(superMethod(A.class, B.class));
    }
}

The thing I don't like with this solution is that it is not very versatile nor maintenable

Thanks
